nodes.description: Create a shallow-copied clone of the object. Any nested objects or arrays will be copied by reference, not duplicated.
nodes.name: clone
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.clone(input.in)

nodes.description: Fill in undefined properties in object with values from the defaults objects, and return the object. As soon as the property is filled, further defaults will have no effect.
nodes.name: defaults
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.defaults(input.in, input.defaults)

nodes.description: Output a copy of the object, filtered to only have values for the whitelisted keys (or array of valid keys)
nodes.name: extend
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.extend(input.in)

nodes.description: Groups an object by it's differentiator
nodes.name: group

phrases.active: Determining whether the object has key {{input.key}}

nodes.description: Does the object contain the given key? Identical to object.hasOwnProperty(key), but uses a safe reference to the hasOwnProperty function, in case it's been overridden accidentally.
nodes.name: has
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.has(input.in, input.key)

nodes.description: Retrieves a copy of the object where the keys have become the values and the values the keys. For this to work, all of your object's values should be unique and string serializable
nodes.name: invert
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.invert(input.in)

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is an Arguments Object
nodes.name: isArguments
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isArguments(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is an Array
nodes.name: isArray
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isArray(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a boolean

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a Boolean
nodes.name: isBoolean
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isBoolean(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a Date

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a Date
nodes.name: isDate
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isDate(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a DOM element.
nodes.name: isElement
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isElement(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object contains no values (no enumerable own-properties)
nodes.name: isEmpty
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isEmpty(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Performs an optimized deep comparison between the two objects, to determine if they should be considered equal.
nodes.name: isEqual
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isEqual(input.object, input.other)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a finite number

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a Finite Number
nodes.name: isFinite
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isFinite(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a function

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a Function
nodes.name: isFunction
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isFunction(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is NaN
nodes.name: isNaN
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isNaN(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is Null
nodes.name: isNull
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isNull(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a number

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a Number
nodes.name: isNumber
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isNumber(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is an Object
nodes.name: isObject
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isObject(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a RegExp

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a RegExp
nodes.name: isRegExp
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isRegExp(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

phrases.active: Determining whether object is a string

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is a String
nodes.name: isString
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isString(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Outputs true if object is Undefined
nodes.name: isUndefined
nodes.fn: if(underscore.isUndefined(input.object)) { output.yes = true; } else { output.no = true; }

nodes.description: Retrieve all the names of the object's properties
nodes.name: keys
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.keys(input.in)

nodes.description: Gets a sorted list of the names of every method in an object — that is to say, the name of every function property of the object
nodes.name: methods
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.methods(input.in)

nodes.description: Return a copy of the object, filtered to omit the blacklisted keys (or array of keys)
nodes.name: omit
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.omit(input.in, input.omit)

nodes.description: Retrieve key value pairs from an object
nodes.name: pairs
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.pairs(input.in)

nodes.description: Output a copy of the object, filtered to only have values for the whitelisted keys (or array of valid keys)
nodes.name: pick
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.pick(input.in, input.pick)

nodes.description: Set a property on an object, or else create a new object and set the property
nodes.name: set

nodes.description: Retrieve all of the values of the object's properties
nodes.name: values
nodes.fn: output.out = underscore.values(input.in)
